FuncDef:
The port split command configures an interface splitting mode so that the bandwidth mode of the configured interface can be switched.
The undo port split command cancels the configuration.
By default, no configuration file is generated.
CLIs: port split dimension interface { { <ifname1> | <iftype1> <ifnum1> } [ to { <ifname2> | <iftype2> <ifnum2> } ] } &<1-12> split-type <splittype>
undo port split dimension interface { { <ifname1> | <iftype1> <ifnum1> } [ to { <ifname2> | <iftype2> <ifnum2> } ] } &<1-12> [ split-type <splittype> ]

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To switch the working mode of an interface, run the port split command.
After this command is executed, a single port is switched to multiple ports or a single port. The port after switching is the same as that of a common port. For example: 100GE1/0/0 is changed to 25GE1/0/0:0, 25GE1/0/0:1, 25GE1/0/0:2, and 25GE1/0/0:3.
Configuration Impact
Switch the port type or working mode on the device. The following scenarios are involved:
The hash function is implemented. When a single port is switched to multiple ports or a single port, port reestablishment is deleted and all configurations on the port are lost.After the bandwidth sharing function is enabled and multiple ports are switched to multiple ports, some ports are deleted and re-created, and all configurations on the deleted ports are lost.

Precautions
After this command is executed, a single port is switched to multiple ports or a single port, port reestablishment is deleted and all configurations on the port are lost.
The port split command cannot be run on a FlexE interface.
